Classes¶

class consent_helper.ConsentHelper(subject_instance, exception_cls=None, **kwargs)[source]¶
get_consent_models()[source]¶

Gets consent models for this subject_instance.

get_current_consent_version()[source]¶

Returns the current consent version relative to the given subject_instance report_datetime and subject_identifier.

is_consented_for_subject_instance()[source]¶

Searches for a valid consent instance for this subject for the possible consent models.

If model class of the subject instance is listed in the consent catalogue under the consent of a different subject, such as with mother and their infants, get the other subject’s identifier from the get_consent_subject_identifier().

set_consent_models()[source]¶

Sets consent models for this instance by querying the AttachedModel class.

set_report_datetime()[source]¶

Sets the datetime field to use to compare with the start and end dates of consents listed in the consent catalogue.

The report_datetime comes from the subject_instance.

set_subject_identifier()[source]¶

Gets the subject_identifier from the instance.

set_subject_instance(subject_instance)[source]¶

Sets the subject instance after confirming model is listed and active in AttachedModels.

See also

Results may not be as expected. See comment on base_consented_model_form.BaseConsentedModelForm check_attached().

validate_versioned_fields()[source]¶

Validate fields under consent version control to be set to the default value or not (None).

This validation logic should also be applied in the forms.py along with more field specific validation logic.
